virtues.comment: THIS DICT DOES NOTHING - it's purely here for quick reference of some possible virtues, you are not constrained to using these nor should you use these lists
prev_lead_virtues: endurance in the face of hardship
knowing when to fight and when to choose peace
the strength to overcome their fears

text: m_c leaves to speak with StarClan. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/close/closes} {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eyes and {VERB/m_c/are/is} immediately surrounded by {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} loved ones, friends, and Clanmates who have passed on. Stars shine throughout their pelts, and their eyes are warm as they greet the new leader.

As m_c dreams that night, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/find/finds} {PRONOUN/m_c/self} walking the stars of Silverpelt, a ghostly landscape surrounding {PRONOUN/m_c/object} and a single, starry cat sat within a clearing.

m_c leaves to speak with StarClan. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/close/closes} {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eyes and {VERB/m_c/awaken/awakens} under a vast, inky black sky. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/turn/turns} around to see a wary group of cats approaching, stars dotting their fur.

default_life.text: r_c approaches, dipping {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} head in greeting. "I give you a life for [virtue]." {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/meow/meows}, before slipping back into the crowd.

life_giving.text: The starry cat approaches {PRONOUN/m_c/object} and, although the cat is unfamiliar, their meeting still feels like a reunion with an old friend. "My name is r_c. You meet me tonight, but the cats under your care will all meet me one day when they join the stars. For now," the cat presses {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} nose to m_c's forehead, "Take this gift, to help you [virtue]."
virtue: endure in the face of hardship
know when to fight and when to choose peace
have the strength to overcome your fears
see the dawn behind the darkness

life_giving.text: Suddenly, the mist at the edge of the clearing takes shape. Dozens of wispy, starry spirits emerge, quickly surrounding m_c. "We grant you your remaining [life_num] lives."  Individually, each voice is distant, but together, the force of their words shakes m_c to {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} core.  "Use them well, with our blessing."  And in a heartbeat, they were gone.
r_c pads up to the new leader, softly touching {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} nose to m_c's head. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/give/gives} a life for [virtue].

m_c is breathless when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/see/sees} r_c approach. Fierce pride burns in r_c's eyes as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/greet/greets} {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} child, pressing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} nose to m_c's forehead and giving {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a life for [virtue].
virtue: courage in the face of hardship

life_giving.text: m_c is breathless when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/see/sees} r_c approach. Fierce pride, and a bit of guilt, burns in r_c's eyes as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/greet/greets} {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} child, pressing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} nose to m_c's forehead and giving {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a life for [virtue]. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/whisper/whispers} a quick apology for what {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'ve'/'s'} done, before {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/turn/turns} and {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} back into the gloom.
virtue: courage in the face of hardship

Love shines in r_c's eyes as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/give/gives} a life for [virtue].
virtue: courage in the face of hardship

r_c walks up to m_c, offering a life for [virtue]. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/smile/smiles}, and {VERB/r_c/state/states} that the Clan will do well under m_c's leadership.
r_c steps forward to give m_c a life for [virtue]. m_c grits {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} teeth as the life rushes into {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.

r_c dips {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} head in greeting. Energy surges through m_c's pelt as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/receive/receives} a life for [virtue]. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/reassure/reassures} m_c that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is} almost done.

r_c waltzes up to m_c's side like a whirlwind, {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} fur sticking up in all angles. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/give/gives} the new leader a life for [virtue] before dashing off into the crowd of starlight.

r_c presses {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} nose to m_c's forehead, offering a life for [virtue]. Before {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to the line of StarClan cats, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/whisper/whispers} to keep an eye on c_n, not just the horizons.
After giving a small lecture on the blessings and curses of being so open minded to what lay beyond the border, r_c happily gives m_c a life for [virtue].

Knowing that c_n may tread upon new ground under m_c's leadership, r_c carefully gives a life for [virtue] and urges caution before being so bold.

r_c grunts out a warning to the new leader to not be so thick-headed in the future. Bold action can yield victory, but would the cost of life be worth it? r_c lets the question sink in after giving a life for [virtue].

r_c gave m_c a searching look, hesitation crossing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} features before placing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} muzzle against m_c's head. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/give/gives} a life for [virtue] and stepped away as quietly as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} came.
